titleStmt.title: A Transcription of the Codex Sinaiticus

respStmt.name: The Institute for Textual Scholarship and Electronic Editing
University of Birmingham
the Arts and Humanities Research Council
D.C. Parker
Amy Myshrall
T.A.E. Brown
with Members of the Institüt für neutestamentliche Textforschung, Münster

editionStmt.edition: Version 1.91 (upgrade towards 2.00, not a public release), last updated 3.2.2023

availability.p: Available for noncommercial re-use provided attribution is made to the original creators and the subsequent derivative is licensed as ShareAlike (Creative Commons by-nc-sa)

projectDesc.p: This transcription was made by the Codex Sinaiticus Project as part of an online presentation and edition of Codex Sinaiticus between 2002 and 2010.

editorialDecl.p: This transcription covers part of the manuscript and is a working document for the new website release in 2023.

note.translation: He is the first... [rest of text obliterated] (Explanation of Rev. 6:8)

note.reading: مائة واربعون الفاً صديقون الذين ختموا من اثنى عشر قبائل اسرائل
note.translation: One hundred and forty thousand believers who were marked with a seal - from the 12 tribes of Israel (calculation based on Rev. 7:4)

margin.note: مائة واربعون الفاً صديقون الذين ختموا من اثنى عشر قبائل اسرائل
ὅτε ετεχθη ο χϲ κατα ϲαρκα

note.translation: At the time when our Lord the Messiah was born in ﬂesh (note on Rev. 7:9-10)

note.reading: وعندما استشهد وقتل كسره على اسمر السيد المسيح
note.translation: After he has become a martyr and was killed... (Note on Rev. 7:12-13, continuing the gloss at the top of this column)

margin.note: وعندما استشهد وقتل كسره على اسمر السيد المسيح

note.reading: قال وعند ابتداء الالف السّابع يتكامل اضطهاد وقيل واحران الشهداء الذين على اسمر السيد المسيح اشتهدوا
note.translation: And at the beginning of the seventh thousand a persecution [of Christians] will take place. They say that [other] martyrs, who were martyred on the Messiah’s lance... (An explanation of the prophecy at Rev. 8:1)

margin.note: قال وعند ابتداء الالف السّابع يتكامل اضطهاد وقيل واحران الشهداء الذين على اسمر السيد المسيح اشتهدوا

note.reading: ثم يكون هدوًا ويكثر القديسون وتصعد ڡرلبهم وتجوزهم الي الرب وفي اعقاب ذلك تحدث اصناف السحطات ودلائل الاٮڡصى
note.translation: Then the peace and calmness will come and the number of holy men increase. Their [...] will be elevated and will compel them to appear in front of the Lord. And as a consequence will appear [...] (A continuation of the gloss below column 1)

margin.note: ثم يكون هدوًا ويكثر القديسون وتصعد ڡرلبهم وتجوزهم الي الرب وفي اعقاب ذلك تحدث اصناف السحطات ودلائل الاٮڡصى

ab.w:
τρι
ثم يظهر نجم الاعارينون كالخربق في السماء الذي قد سُماه افسنتيس اى افسنتيو يقع فى الماه وكثيرون ما
τον

note.comment: The first hand appears to have written the quire signature ϙα, and a later corrector erased the α and replaced it with something unreadable
The first hand appears to have written the quire signature ϙβ, and a later corrector erased the β and replaced it with something unreadable

div.title: Ὁ Ποιμήν του Ἑρμά

note.comment: The first hand wrote the quire signature ϙγ, and a later corrector erased the γ and replaced it with something unreadable

ab.note: There are traces of letters at the ends of the following lines in this column: line 4 possible α ι; line 7 υ; line 8 ϲ; line 9 υ.

margin.note: In this column, only the first letter of the line, generally incomplete, remains. They do not always match other forms of text, and where this is the case there is no supplied text.

ab.note: There is a vertical stroke with part of another stroke at the top.
There is a deletion hook before the ν. The manuscript may have contained a repetition of a sequence of letters.
Trace of the top of a curved letter. Most likely to be top of ϲ.
Trace of ο at beginning of line is present in 2006 image but not in 2008 and 2009 images.

rdg.w:
αυThe initial τ is partly on a piece of parchment attached to one of the fragments of Q95-1v
το

ab.note: The initial τ is partly on a piece of parchment attached to one of the fragments of Q95-1v
Upper part of ν visible. κ partly as silhouette of the edge of the parchment. α likewise probably, but partly hidden by a fold in the parchment.
Only the very top of ν and η either side of φ are present, and likewise of the final two characters.

ab.w:
ε
There is probably a space and possibly a dot after φηϲιν.
θνη

πιThere is a flap of parchment bent inwards the reconstruction at the end is by no means certain, given the faintness of the letters and the repeated vertical strokes.
ϲτευϲαντα
ab.note: The final ω has virtually no ink and some distortion.
There is no room for ϲ in εϲχον as the parchment is displayed in the image. There is unlikely to be any significant distortion here.

ab.w:
ευφρανθηϲεThe final ε is partly on a piece of parchment attached to one of the fragments of Q95-1r
ται
